intro: Machaerina robinsonii, commonly known as the Robinson's machaerina, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, leathery leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in the lower North Island and parts of the South Island of New Zealand. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
